Hi there ! I'm trying to query tasks through task search API, But apparently search API is behaving weird for same filters defined in different functions.
Is there something that I'm missing ? and same quires were working fine yesterday
Are you having troubles with getting the contacts who submitted the form, or with the data that comes with the contact?
What queries are you doing and what's the expected result?
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PU4LV8/p1669206089323439>

Good morning i have a question, we have an api keys active on HubSpot, and now we have activivated a new license. anyone can tell me if it's possible to import api from an account HubSpot to another, and then migrate it to the new private app?
Are you talking about migrating the logs from one HubSpot account to another?
hi Arno thanks for answering, i think also the script it generates from api
Nobody?
Are you switching from one HubSpot account to another?
yes

Not sure what the procedure for that is. But my bet would be to contact support, if it's not possible, there's going to be a lot of work needed to set over all the info from one account to the other.
You'll need to indeed switch the HubSpot tracking code, and everything you want to use on the other account.
ah sure perfect
thanks for your support
Is it possible to see where successful API calls are coming from?

I've also wondered this because you can see the ip for a failed request but not the ip for a successful one. Currently I don't think this is possible, theres no api for those logs just the ui and because I don't see it from the ui I don't think you can add it
Yhea I'm afraid so as well. Would make cleaning up API calls for the sunset a lot easier :smile:
Yeah so true

Is there a way to send emails via a private app? Without Gmail or Microsoft, it is not possible to use emails via SMTP. For several reasons, I would like to send the emails via my own server. But according to HubSpot there is no option.

So you are looking for a way to send Emails "from HubSpot" but send from your own server?  i mean you could extract your contacts an use an Open Source Email Server running on your own. Though the question is if that server is also whitelisted which is important for email delivery rates

I receive my e-mails via my own server. I then forward a copy via BCC to my HubSpot team mailbox so that I can process it there. If I reply via HubSpot, the email is sent by HubSpot itself. I neither have a sent mail on my mail server, nor can I sign or archive my email.
so you would like to have a sent email which, in your email account looks like you replied from your server, when in reality you replied from a completely different server?

I would like to have SMTP settings for team mailboxes or email channels. This way I could send from HubSpot directly via my server and sign my emails.
Alternatively, and without signature, would be a BCC setting for outgoing emails. This way I could at least put outgoing emails into the archive.
The problem is simply the law. All business email traffic (inbound and outbound) must be archived for many years without gaps. This is not possible with HubSpot without Google / Microsoft.
"Below is the simple guide on how to configure HubSpot to send outgoing emails using your SMTP2GO’s SMTP Server": <https://www.smtp2go.com/setupguide/HubSpot/>
does this help?
No, sorry. This is just for personal emails. Dont work with team inboxes.
ohh sorry, forgot about that detail
I just don't understand why the functions already exist in the system, but they are not also used for team mailboxes. SMTP and IMAP are already available.
Or add a simple BCC field for each chan.
i guess its not that simple with a team inbox
Why? When you send an email, the only difference is whether you connect to the HubSpot server or to a custom server. And the function to connect to a custom SMTP server allready in use in the system
tbh that was just a guess, i am not that familiar with email server configuration
I understand. But back to my main question. Is there any way to send emails with a private app?

Hi team, I am using '<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts>' to pull all our contacts. But it limits to only 100 rows (json). Anyone succeeded pulling all contacts using endpoint? Please let me know.
You need to use the paging parameters
Each api call is maxed at 100 objects but you can get the next group if you page
Is there any limit in 'paging'?
What do you mean?

[11:15 AM]
You need to use the paging parameters
Yes but what do you mean by limits for paging?
If I need all contacts data, does paging parameter max out anything?
Well say you have 1000 contacts, that means you'll need to make 10 api calls, each call with have a different value in the after parameter
Got it, thank guys.
Of course
You have to use the properties parameter to get more properties
so like `properties=firstname,lastname` at the end of the v3 url will pulling the first and last name properties
It looks like the max number of blog posts before paginating is 300. Can y’all document that somewhere?

new direction on this. is there documentation somewhere on what private app scopes are available? my client is authoring blog posts in HubSpot but i can’t connect to anything useful in the scopes i’m given. i only get options for knowledge base articles. if they have a blog, shouldn’t they have access to a blog scope?
does the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/blog-post> endpoints not give you blogposts as a response?

```GET
/cms/v3/blogs/posts ````
i can’t authorize anything even close to that as a private API scope
what should i be choosing as my private app scope?
when i’ve done this in the past, i have dozens of CMS endpoints available in the scope selection checkboxes. on this client, i only have knowledge_base.articles.
content scope
wow okay. thanks
of course
not used to NOT seeing granulars
Yeah, I didn't realize that the tickets scope is just one scope today instead of crm.objects.tickets.read/write
oh i saw that post
which one?
well i saw a post about ticket scope, i thoguht it was the same, maybe not.
i’ve seen a lot of things today…… digging into what to do with this situation i’ve been hit with……
nothing like “oh we’ve been getting emails but we noticed it’s happening in seven days, do we need to do something?”
smh

Hello, wondering if there's an easy way to find all the notes/meetings associated with all companies?
Looks like right now the easiest way would be to pull the companies from `/crm/v3/objects/companies`, pull the meetings/notes from `/crm/v3/objects/meetings` and `/crm/v3/objects/notes`, then find which meetings/notes go to which company with `/crm/v3/objects/companies/<company_id>/associations/meetings` and ``/crm/v3/objects/companies/<company_id>/associations/notes`?
FWIW, there's also a limit of 10K results per query. To export all our Contacts I ended up using the hs_object_id and "between" to batch groups of 10K IDs

With the root api key I’m able to fetch all the contacts associated to a subscription by doing something like this: `/crm/v4/objects/0-69/$subscriptionId/associations/contacts` . I tried doing the same with a private app access token but I’m getting the following error: “The scope needed for this API call isn’t available for public use. If you have questions, contact support or post in our developer forum”. I already selected all available private app scopes to make sure the error is not related to this.

Have anyone run into the same issue? Could it be that the root api key is granting additional permissions in the back (no restrictions at all over subscriptions, for instance)?

<@U01QVR44MEY> do you happen to know what the property handle is for form submissions? I’ve tried `formSubmissions`, `form-submissions`, `forms`, `submissions` and none of these appear to work. On the v1 API the handle is `form-submissions`, and is included in the response by default
<@U046C9LKJP8> The v1 API includes a list of form submissions when you request a contact’s profile. Im just looking to get the same data on the v3 api

Can anyone tell me where I can find a list of these properties mentioned on this page?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>

Can’t see this mentioned in the documentation anywhere
<@U04BSKJ7U86> the object type is FORM_SUBMISSION or 0-15
You can find all those properties in the property editor in settings if you click on a property and then the </> button you'll be able to see the internal name
Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>, would you please be able to clarify how these values are used in an API request?
What are you trying to do?
I would like to get a list of form submissions for a specific contact
Ah ok

So with the v3 apis you can just get feedback form submissions <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/feedback-submissions#endpoint?spec=GET-/crm/v3/objects/feedback_submissions> and the properties that were updated by the form submissions but not actual form submission events
You can see that info through the ui though <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/analyze-form-submissions-data>
Hmmm so theres no replacement for this data on the v3 APIs? Is there at least a way to query if a specific user has filled out a particular form?
Well you can see if the contact has the data that can only be created through a form
Unfortunately it’s a fairly basic contact form, but it’s just sitting on a specific page we would like to track. So will need to be able to verify if the form has been submitted by the actual form id
You could just have a hidden field on the form... and then just track how many contacts have a value in that property
Yeah thats not a bad idea, we would just need to migrate existing contacts who have filled out this form. Thanks for your help. I will dive a bit deeper into this
Of course, let me know what you end up doing

Hi All, is anybody know how we can identify where the API key  is using in HubSpot ?

I tried with hs functions portal but its not showing anything
Hello everyone, can anybody please help on how to build a private app?
